Belgium: Maximilien Morillon founds the first diocesan seminary in Mechelen.
Burma: Burmese–Siamese War (1568–69) restores Burmese rule in Siam
Indinesia: Peace treaty was signed by Sultan Khairun of Ternate and Governor Lopez De Mesquita of Portuguese.
Latvia: Lithuania and Poland joined to form the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth.  Livonia became a joint domain administered directly by both realms.
Philippine:
Present-day Capiz Province becomes a Spanish settlement.
Legazpi moves the seat of government from Cebu to Iloilo.
King Philip II of Spain, through a royal decree, creates Cebu as the country's first Spanish province; he also appoints Miguel Lopez de Legazpi as governor and captain general of the territory.
Poland: Signing of the Union of Lublin
Russia: The Union of Lublin was signed. Poland and the Grand Duchy of Lithuania were merged into the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth; Poland began aiding Lithuania in its war against Muscovy.
